data.description: Ticker of the platform protocol coin. Options: `BCH` or `tBCH`

A list of BCHD gRPC API server URLs, used for validation of SLP token transactions. It's recommended to add as many servers as possible. The URLs list can be found at [https://bchd.fountainhead.cash/](https://bchd.fountainhead.cash/).
A standard [ActivationMode](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/activation/#activation-mode) object.
If `true`, spawns a background loop to store the local cache of address(es) transactions.
A list of standard [TokensRequest](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/activation/#tokens-request) objects.
Overwrites the address format from coins file, if set. A standard [AddressFormat](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/wallet/#address-format) object.
If `true`, allows bchd_urls to be empty. **Warning:** it is highly unsafe to do so as it may lead to invalid SLP transactions generation and tokens burning.
If `false`, coin and token balances will not be returned in the response, and the response will be returned more quickly.

data.default: value in the coins file, or `3` if not set
data.description: Confirmations to wait for steps in swap.
Has no effect on BCH.

If `true` the Komodo DeFi Framework API will preload transaction history as a background process. Must be set to `true` to use the [my_tx_history](/komodo-defi-framework/api/legacy/my_tx_history/#my-tx-history) method

A standard [UtxoMergeParams](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/activation/#utxo-merge-params) object. Used to reduce a wallet's UTXO count in cases where it is causing significantly slower RPC responses.
Block height of the coin being activated
A standard [AddressInfo](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/wallet/#address-info) object. Note: the structure may vary based on the value of the `get_balances` parameter.
A standard [AddressInfo](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/wallet/#address-info) object. Note: the structure may vary based on the value of the `get_balances` parameter.
Ticker of the ERC20 like token coin.

data.default: value in the coins file if not set
data.description: Confirmations to wait for steps in swap.
Ticker of the Tendermint asset.

data.default: value in the coins file if not set
data.description: Confirmations to wait for steps in swap.
Ticker of the platform protocol coin. Options: `ETH`, `AVAX`, `BNB`, `FTM`, `MATIC`, `ONE`, `ETH-ARB20`
Required if not set in `coins` file. Informs the Komodo DeFi Framework API whether or not the coin is expected to function. Accepted values are `0` or `1`
Address of etomic swap smart contract
Address of backup etomic swap smart contract.
A list of standard [CoinNode](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/activation/#coin-node) objects.
A list of standard [TokensRequest](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/activation/#tokens-request) objects.

For ETH/ERC20 and other gas model chains. Defines the decimals used to denominate the gas station response to gwei units. For example, the ETH gas station uses 8 decimals, which means that "average": 860 is equal to 86 gwei. While the Matic gas station uses 9 decimals, so 860 would mean 860 gwei exactly.

For ETH/ERC20 and other gas model chains. Defines the method of gas price calculation from the station response. `"MeanAverageFast"` will use the mean between average and fast fields. `"Average"` will return a simple average value.
If `false`, coin and token balances will not be returned in the response, and the response will be returned more quickly.
A standard [PrivKeyPolicy](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/wallet/#priv-key-policy) object.
When the platform coin is involved, the number of confirmations for the Komodo DeFi Framework API to wait during the transaction steps of an atomic swap

If `true`, coins protected by [Komodo Platform's dPoW security](https://satindergrewal.medium.com/delayed-proof-of-work-explained-9a74250dbb86) will wait for a notarization before progressing to the next atomic swap transactions step.
Value can be `Metamask` only when the Komodo DeFi Framework is built targeting `wasm`.

If `true` the Komodo DeFi Framework API will preload transaction history as a background process. Must be set to `true` to use the [my_tx_history](/komodo-defi-framework/api/legacy/my_tx_history/#my-tx-history) method
Encapsulates the request parameters for NFT activation, including NFT provider configuration. A standard [NftProvider](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/nfts/#nft-provider) object.

Must be provided if "use_trading_proto_v2" is true in [your configuration](/komodo-defi-framework/setup/configure-mm2-json/). A standard [SwapV2Contracts](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/activation/#tokens-request) object.
Block height of the coin being activated
A standard [AddressInfo](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/wallet/#address-info) object. Note: the structure may vary based on the value of the `get_balances` parameter.
A standard [AddressInfo](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/wallet/#address-info) object. Note: the structure may vary based on the value of the `get_balances` parameter.
A list of standard [NftInfoBasic](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/nfts/#nft-info) objects.
Ticker of the platform protocol coin. Options: `ATOM`, `IRIS`, `OSMOSIS`
Required if not set in `coins` file. Informs the Komodo DeFi Framework API whether or not the coin is expected to function. Accepted values are `0` or `1`
A list of standard [TokensRequest](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/activation/#tokens-request) objects.
A list of [CoinNode objects](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/activation/#coin-node).

Value can be `ContextPrivKey`,`Trezor` when Komodo DeFi Framework is built for native platforms. value can be `ContextPrivKey`, `Trezor`, `Metamask` when the Komodo DeFi Framework is built targeting `wasm`

If `true` the Komodo DeFi Framework API will preload transaction history as a background process. Must be set to `true` to use the [my_tx_history](/komodo-defi-framework/api/legacy/my_tx_history/#my-tx-history) method

A url for gas station api.

For ETH/ERC20 and other gas model chains. Defines the decimals used to denominate the gas station response to gwei units. For example, the ETH gas station uses 8 decimals, which means that "average": 860 is equal to 86 gwei. While the Matic gas station uses 9 decimals, so 860 would mean 860 gwei exactly.

For ETH/ERC20 and other gas model chains. Defines the method of gas price calculation from the station response. `"MeanAverageFast"` will use the mean between average and fast fields. `"Average"` will return a simple average value.
If `false`, coin and token balances will not be returned in the response, and the response will be returned more quickly.

If `true`, coins protected by [Komodo Platform's dPoW security](https://satindergrewal.medium.com/delayed-proof-of-work-explained-9a74250dbb86) will wait for a notarization before progressing to the next atomic swap transactions step.

If `true` the Komodo DeFi Framework API will preload transaction history as a background process. Must be set to `true` to use the [my_tx_history](/komodo-defi-framework/api/legacy/my_tx_history/#my-tx-history) method
Non-HD only. encapsulates the request parameters for NFT activation, including NFT provider configuration.
HD wallets only. How many additional addreesses to generate at a minimum.
HD wallets only. Whether or not to scan for new addresses. Select from `do_not_scan`, `scan_if_new_wallet` or `scan`. Note that `scan` will result in multple requests to the Komodo DeFi Framework.
HD wallets only. The max number of empty addresses in a row. If transactions were sent to an address outside the `gap_limit`, they will not be identified when scanning.
HD wallets only. A standard [AddressPath](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/wallet/#address-path) object.

Must be provided if "use_trading_proto_v2" is true in [your configuration](/komodo-defi-framework/setup/configure-mm2-json/). A standard [SwapV2Contracts](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/activation/#tokens-request) object.
An identifying number which is used to query task status.
The identifying number returned when initiating the initialisation process.
If `false`, will return final response for completed tasks.
The identifying number returned when initiating the initialisation process.
Object containing the params below
Will be `TrezorPin` for this method
When the Trezor device is displaying a grid of numbers for PIN entry, this param will contain your Trezor pin, as mapped through your keyboard numpad. See the image below for more information.
The outcome of the request.
The identifying number returned when initiating the enabling process.
Indicates task cancellation was succesful.
An error message to explain what went wrong.
An indicator of the class or function which reurned the error.
An indicator of where in the source code the error was thrown.
An enumerated value for the returned error.
The input task ID which resulted in the error.
The ticker of the coin you want to enable.
An object containing the actvation parameters below.
A standard [PrivKeyPolicy](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/wallet/#priv-key-policy) object.
How many additional addreesses to generate at a minimum.
Whether or not to scan for new addresses. Select from `do_not_scan`, `scan_if_new_wallet` or `scan`. Note that `scan` will result in multple requests to the Komodo DeFi Framework.
The max number of empty addresses in a row. If transactions were sent to an address outside the `gap_limit`, they will not be identified when scanning.
An object containing RPC type and data parameters as below.

UTXO RPC mode. Options: `{ "rpc":"Native" }` if running a native blockchain node, or `"rpc":"Electrum"` to use electrum RPCs. If using electrum, a list of electrum servers is required under `rpc_data.servers`
An object containing electrum server information.
A list of electrum server URLs ([https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/coins/tree/master/electrums](https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/coins/tree/master/electrums))
The url and port of a coins electrum server
Used to define electrum server url/port for websocket connections.
Defines electrum server protocol as `TCP` or `SSL`.
For `SSL` electrum connections, this will allow expired certificates.
